title: Active learning example requires that the initial sample size and query size match exactly

labels.name: type: bug
labels.description: Indicates an unexpected problem or unintended behavior

labels.name: type: documentation
labels.description: Improvements or additions to documentation

milestone.title: v0.17.0
milestone.description:
Next Rubrix release milestone

# Features

* Copy input text action #1616

body:
TL;DR: Small problem which causes the first batch to not be displayed, but is likely easy to fix.

**Describe the bug**

In the [active learning with small-text example](https://github.com/recognai/rubrix/blob/b6239fd474694cf4fe0c5f91a45cfcdb8d9f9ec7/docs/tutorials/active_learning_with_small_text.ipynb) I used a larger size of initial samples compared to the original version. Nothing happens in this case, i.e. I don't see a first batch in the UI. 

*Details:*
In the notebook we use the same size (`NUM_SAMPLES`) for initialization...

>
![num initial samples](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6340318/179820817-19f8df54-f2cf-4dd1-8c01-b4a8ad4bdd4f.png)

...and for querying:
![num query sizes](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6340318/179820991-a989a2f8-ff57-4bd3-b5d4-fb51bbb612e5.png)

For this reason the listener does not fire, since the condition checks for exactly `NUM_SAMPLES`-many samples:
`condition=lambda search: search.total==NUM_SAMPLES`.

*Suggestion:*
From the active learning perspective, it should not be a requirement that the initial sample size and query size must match. Consequently, there are three cases:

1. initial sample size > query_size
2. initial sample size == query_size
3. initial sample size < query_size

The second case already works. By changing the condition to `>=` I solved my specific problem (first case) as well. Now we still have to handle the third case. Honestly, I don't know how to fix this elegantly. I could treat the first batch separately, but that would also bloat the code. *Is there an additional clause we could add to the condition?*

**To Reproduce**
Navigate to the [active learning with small-text example](https://github.com/recognai/rubrix/blob/b6239fd474694cf4fe0c5f91a45cfcdb8d9f9ec7/docs/tutorials/active_learning_with_small_text.ipynb) and increase the initial number of samples (first picture), e.g. to 100.

**Expected behavior**
The initial data should be recognized as complete and the first active learning batch (batch-0) should be created and loaded into rubrix.

**Screenshots**
none

**Environment (please complete the following information):**
 - Rubrix Version 0.17.0.dev0
 - ElasticSearch Version 7.10.2

**Additional context**
none

title: UI Annotation : Improve the batch annotation support

labels.name: type: enhancement
labels.description: Indicates new feature requests

labels.name: area: ui
labels.description: Indicates that an issue or pull request is related to the User Interface (UI)

labels.name: type: community request
labels.description: Indicates a feature requested by someone outside of the Argilla organization

body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
Now, when annotating records and some filters are enabled (`status:Default`, `annotated_as:<some-specifi-value>`) the pagination, filter counts, and query results may not correspond to the real values. This situation happens because the annotation process changes some record properties that can affect to the filter results.

See related issue #1597

**Describe the solution you'd like**
The idea of this feature is to combine the 2-step validation and automatic data refresh. 

Like token classification does, the modified records will be set in a `Pending` state prior to saving. And this behavior will be the common task behavior.

**Describe alternatives you've considered**

A single `Save` global action will be included for the annotation confirmation (save selected records that are in a pending status) and individual validations won't be allowed.

After saving a batch of records, the data will be refreshed automatically. This will refresh records, pagination, and filter statuses. 

For the pre-annotated records (predictions), the 2-step validation step must be applied in the same way as for manual reviews.

For  `Annotate as`  action in text classification tasks, we can :

* Annotate and save records
* Mark all of them in a Pending state and then confirm the changes manually with the  `Save` button.

The Refresh button will be totally removed from the records and datasets view. We should discuss about behaviour described in #1590

**Additional context**
N/A

I'm always frustrated when I want to copy record text but I am not able to. Sometimes I want to copy text and check out it"s dependency parser on another tool but currently there is no straightforward way to do so.

**Describe alternatives you've considered**
1. Alternative can be a copy icon next to ":" but that won"t be neat as copy is a peripheral activity
2. Inspect result item and copy text from developer tools. (Overkill)

title: Support for hierarchical multilabel text classification (taxonomy)

labels.name: type: enhancement
labels.description: Indicates new feature requests

labels.name: type: community request
labels.description: Indicates a feature requested by someone outside of the Argilla organization

labels.name: type: popular request
labels.description: Indicates that several people outside of the Argilla organization are interested in this feature

body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
A relatively common text classification task I encounter is hierarchical multi-label classification, like classifying scientific paper abstracts or e-commerce product descriptions in one of more nested classes. From what I've seen rubrix still has no support for this type of labeling.

**Describe the solution you'd like**
I'd like to request support for hierarchical multi-label text classification. One of my favorite implementations of this [comes from label-studio](https://labelstud.io/tags/taxonomy.html). Ideally, the task model would allow for truncated classification and a limit of labels per document.

**Describe alternatives you've considered**
One workaround would be "flattening" the available labels by concatenating label names and treating each combination independently, but this approach gets out of hand fast as the number of classes increase. It also suffers from loss of information as we discard parent classes context for child classes. Another problem with flattening is related to "truncated" classes, for example if both `Natural sciences > Biology > Mammals` and `Natural sciences > Biology` are valid classes, the number of flattened classes increases a lot, cluterring the interface.

Another workaround would be listing all level 1, 2 ... n classes available and trusting the annotator to input only valid combinations, but that again is a less-than-optimal workflow and might result in ambiguous or invalid labels.

**Additional context**
Relevant references using this labeling task model:
- https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S0022000013000718#:~:text=Hierarchical%20multi%2Dlabel%20classification%20is,class%20in%20each%20hierarchical%20level.
- https://aclanthology.org/2021.naacl-main.335/

title: Python labeling API not made available even though in docs

labels.name: type: bug
labels.description: Indicates an unexpected problem or unintended behavior

body:
**Describe the bug**
The Python Reference section has a part on ["Labeling"](https://rubrix.readthedocs.io/en/master/reference/python/python_labeling.html), but the functionality described is not available on Rubrix. rb.labeling is never made available in the [__init__](https://github.com/recognai/rubrix/blob/master/src/rubrix/__init__.py), and it's own __init__ is empty.

**Expected behavior**
I expected to be use the code; This is also related to #1554 as the labeling library seems to have relevant code for adding/view/backup rules via Python.

Was this code deprecated, and if so is there any plan to remake it available? Just like the discussion linked, I have the use case of having rules already saved in a spreadsheet; And not being to programmatically backup/load them makes it harder to convince the team to use the tool for rule creation.

**Environment:**
 - OS [e.g. iOS]: Linux Mint
 - Rubrix Version: 0.15

title: Argilla datasets data model
body:
This line focuses related to the rubrix dataset data model revision. This revision affects to several levels:

- **How datasets are shared/persisted.** Storing a dataset should not only store its data but store the data with configuration/settings. We must include a mechanism for that. When publishing datasets with settings to Huggingface, we're losing the dataset settings (that will be a problem when extending the number of setting to tune-up)

- **How client-server interaction occurs**. A module-level approach could be not enough when manipulating datasets from disk or external data sources. We must fill the gap between data manipulation and dataset manipulation (configuration, settings,...). We must offer a way to naturally use or extend the current `DatasetFor....` classes in combination with settings and base method (log, load,...)


Related Issues:

- argilla-io/roadmap#3
- argilla-io/argilla#1861
- argilla-io/argilla#1828
- argilla-io/argilla#1854
- argilla-io/argilla#1855

title: [Progress Metrics] Not updated when pressing "Refresh"

labels.name: type: bug
labels.description: Indicates an unexpected problem or unintended behavior

milestone.title: v0.17.0
milestone.description:
Next Rubrix release milestone

# Features

* Copy input text action #1616

body:
**Describe the bug**
When you add records to a dataset and press the "Refresh" button, the new records will appear, and also the "Records (x)" in the upper right corner will get updated. However, the Progress Metrics will not update and the total will not reflect the total number of records in the dataset. The Progress bar gets updated only when you start annotating.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. create a dataset
2. start annotating
3. add some more records
4. press the Refresh button
5. the total in the Progress metrics stays the same

**Expected behavior**
The "Refresh" button should also update the Progress metrics. Otherwise, for an active learning loop this is can get a bit confusing. 

**Screenshots**
If applicable, add screenshots to help explain your problem.

**Environment (please complete the following information):**
 - OS [e.g. iOS]: Ubuntu
 - Browser [e.g. chrome, safari]: firefox
 - Rubrix Version [e.g. 0.10.0]: master
 - ElasticSearch Version [e.g. 7.10.2]: 7.10.2
 - Docker Image (optional) [e.g. rubrix:v0.10.0]:  


**Additional context**
Add any other context about the problem here.

title: Accepting several predictions/annotations for the same record

labels.name: type: enhancement
labels.description: Indicates new feature requests

labels.name: type: community request
labels.description: Indicates a feature requested by someone outside of the Argilla organization

labels.name: type: popular request
labels.description: Indicates that several people outside of the Argilla organization are interested in this feature

body:
## Introduction

Currently, records annotations/predictions only support store annotation info for just one annotator agent. The idea is to support several agents, for both, annotations and predictions. This change will bring several feature enhancements such as **annotations agreement flows**, **weak label materialization**, **multi-pipeline monitoring**, and more.

We could give more annotation/prediction control if we combine this feature with roles and dataset settings. By defining a set of annotators (even expected predictors patterns), we can limit the number of agents that can annotate a dataset.

## Design keys

The proposed design keeps the `prediction/annotation` fields and includes a new `predictions/annotations` one, a data dictionary where the key corresponds to the annotation agent, and the value includes the annotation information provided by the client.

```python
predictions = { “agent-one” : { “labels”: [“A”], “score”: [“0.3”] } } 
``` 

This new structure will be enabled for search, providing a mechanism for fine-tuning the searches based on specific annotators/predictors. We can replicate all computed fields per annotation entry, so we could do things like:
`annotations.agentA.annotated_as: FALSE` or `predictions.agent_b.predicted_as:  TRUE`


## Backward compatibility

The new data model must tackle current record concepts, and provide a backward compatibility method to make both modes live.

Current fields such as `predicted`, `predicted_as`, and `annotated_as` could change the behavior since multiple values can be assigned. The only case where we can keep the old behavior should be when only an entry is provided.

Complete list of affected fields:

- `predicted`: computed only when one single agent is defined. It will be deprecated and removed in future versions
- `predicted_as`: computed only when one single agent is defined. It will be deprecated and removed in future versions
- `annotated_as`: computed only when one single agent is defined. It will be deprecated and removed in future versions
- `predicted_by`: showing all record agents
- `annotated_by`: showing all record agents 
- `scores`: computed only when one single agent is defined (cc: @dvsrepo). It will be deprecated and removed in future versions
- `prediction`: this field will be deprecated and removed in future versions
- `annotation`: this field will be use as the "final/real annotation" (annotation agreement). Maybe a better naming in future versions.
- `explanation`: (only for text classification) computed only when one single agent is defined. It will be deprecated and removed in future versions. The explanation must be defined at the prediction level.
- token classification metrics: there are some metrics defined for annotations and predictions. Maybe does not make sense to build all agent metrics, but these fields will be totally affected by the new data model.

## References

See recognai/rubrix-roadmap#59

Maybe add an option for applying the bulk action to all the records of the query.

title: [Search in UI] Search highlighting breaks for a single dot.

labels.name: type: bug
labels.description: Indicates an unexpected problem or unintended behavior

labels.name: area: ui
labels.description: Indicates that an issue or pull request is related to the User Interface (UI)

body:
**Describe the bug**
When searching for `text.exact:.` the UI highlights seemingly arbitrary symbols in the text, but not the actual `.`.
When searching for `text.exact:*\!` it also only highlights the word before the exclamation mark, but not the exclamation mark itself.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Go to our dev environment
2. Go to the `score_filter_bug` dataset
3. Search for `text.exact:.`
4. Search for `text.exact:*\!`

**Expected behavior**
Only `.` should be highlighted.

**Screenshots**
If applicable, add screenshots to help explain your problem.

**Environment (please complete the following information):**
 - OS [e.g. iOS]: Ubuntu
 - Browser [e.g. chrome, safari]: firefox
 - Rubrix Version [e.g. 0.10.0]: dev
 - ElasticSearch Version [e.g. 7.10.2]: dev
 - Docker Image (optional) [e.g. rubrix:v0.10.0]:  


**Additional context**
Add any other context about the problem here.

title: fix(#1548): access datasets for superusers when workspace is not provided
body:
~~We still check when creating a new dataset in a different workspace when exists a dataset with the same name in a different one.~~

Closes #1548

title: refactor: remove `words` references in searches
body:
This PR finish work related to the issue #945  

Changes included in this PR make default query text searches change a little bit since we start using only the `text` field as the default search field, where the standard analyzer is applied. Searches with special characters, like `!` or `.` are not covered by this analyzer.

So, we should include a warning message somewhere in the documentation to advise these changes.

@dcfidalgo @dvsrepo Any recommendation about how to tackle the communication?

title: ci: check conda env cache
body: This PR reduces the environment preparation from minutes to several seconds by caching the conda environment.

title: fix(#1551): don't show error traces for EntityNotFoundError's
fix(#1551): don't show error traces for EntityNotFoundError's
Feat: Improve from datasets
body:
This PR improves a bit the `Dataset*.from_datasets` mechanics. Instead of running x-times over the entire dataset for parsing x columns, we do the parsing of all columns in one go over the dataset.

- improves performance
- makes the ignore columns message less confusing

It also provides a "proper" fix to support the new datasets 2.3.0 version (not the push_to_hub issue, but the one when renaming a column).

title: fix: compatibility with new dataset version

labels.name: type: bug
labels.description: Indicates an unexpected problem or unintended behavior

body:
This makes Rubrix compatible with the new datasets 2.3.0 version.

It is rather a dirty fix, I'll make a follow-up PR with a proper fix while refactoring/improving a bit the `Dataset*.from_datasets` mechanics.

title: feat(#1561): standardize icons
body:
closes #1561

This PR includes icons from the https://css.gg/ library and renames the icons to match

title: docs: change theme to furo

labels.name: type: documentation
labels.description: Improvements or additions to documentation

body:
Built docu:
https://rubrix.readthedocs.io/en/docs-change_theme_to_furo/

See #1543 and #1512

title: Rubrix pod is ready without being able to connect to Elastic

labels.name: type: bug
labels.description: Indicates an unexpected problem or unintended behavior

labels.name: status: stale
labels.description: Indicates that there is no activity on an issue or pull request

body:
**Describe the bug**
I just noticed a small bug/feature turned into a bug, where I explicitly set the elastic endpoint ELASTICSEARCH, and only found out the connection didn't work (I updated the elastic it) after the pod having been ready, but unused for a while. IMO, being connected to elastic should be part of the readiness. 

**To Reproduce**
either by direct deployment, or changing the elastic after deployment.

**Expected behavior**
A failing readiness probe when not connected to elastic.

**Screenshots*
n.a.

**Environment (please complete the following information):**
 - Rubrix Version [e.g. 0.10.0]: 0.13
 - ElasticSearch Version [e.g. 7.10.2]: 1.17

**Additional context**
Add any other context about the problem here.

title: fix(#1551): don't show error traces for EntityNotFoundError's
body: Closes #1551

title: Standardize Icons
body:
- [x] Import the free icon library to Figma https://css.gg/ 
- [x] Create icons use type
- [x] replace icons file 

### Icon use type

### Button icon 

- The icon is composing the full button 
- Had to be associated with a strong tooltip

### Icon inside a button 

- The icon is associated with a copy 
- No tooltip

### Icon standard 

- Clickable icon 
- Should be associated with a classic tooltip

### Illustrative icon

- No clickable
- Had to be associated with an information copy

title: docs: Add pip version and dockertag as parameter in the build process

labels.name: type: documentation
labels.description: Improvements or additions to documentation

body:
This PR adds automatic substitutions of pip versions and docker tags in `rst` files. But I did not manage to make it work for the `user-management.ipynb` notebook. I propose to move the content of this notebook to a `rst` or `md` file, since there is not too much code.
@frascuchon should I proceed, or should I keep trying to make it also work for notebooks?

title: [Load records] Handle server errors that occurred in `rb.load`

labels.name: type: bug
labels.description: Indicates an unexpected problem or unintended behavior

labels.name: good first issue
labels.description: Indicates a good issue for first-time contributors

milestone.title: v0.17.0
milestone.description:
Next Rubrix release milestone

# Features

* Copy input text action #1616

body:
**Describe the bug**
When something is wrong when loading data with `rb.load`, the original error is not shown, and a cryptic error appears instead.

**To Reproduce**
Try to load a dataset with a malformed query. You'll the error:

```bash
...
  File "/usr/local/anaconda3/envs/rubrix/lib/python3.8/contextlib.py", line 131, in __exit__
    self.gen.throw(type, value, traceback)
  File "/usr/local/anaconda3/envs/rubrix/lib/python3.8/site-packages/httpcore/_exceptions.py", line 12, in map_exceptions
    raise to_exc(exc) from None
httpcore.RemoteProtocolError: peer closed connection without sending complete message body (incomplete chunked read)
```

**Expected behavior**
A clear original error description should be shown.

**Environment (please complete the following information):**
 - OS [e.g. iOS]:
 - Browser [e.g. chrome, safari]:
 - Rubrix Version [e.g. 0.10.0]: 0.14.0
 - ElasticSearch Version [e.g. 7.10.2]:
 - Docker Image (optional) [e.g. rubrix:v0.10.0]:

title: [Text2Text] Edit button doesn't work

labels.name: type: bug
labels.description: Indicates an unexpected problem or unintended behavior

body:
**Describe the bug**
When we are in Text2Text annotation mode and we want to edit prediction, if we click on the "Edit" button nothing happens

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Go to Text2Text dataset
2. Go to annotation mode
3. Click on "Edit" button

**Expected behavior**
The edit button should display an editable textarea

**Environment**
 - OS [e.g. iOS]:
 - Browser [e.g. chrome, safari]:
 - Rubrix Version [e.g. 0.10.0]:
 - ElasticSearch Version [e.g. 7.10.2]:
 - Docker Image (optional) [e.g. rubrix:v0.10.0]:

title: [WeakMultiLabels] Merge with WeakLabels using a 2 dim wl matrix
body:
The current implementation of the weak label matrix for multi-label classifications is overcomplicated (3-dim), and the MajorityVoter does not take advantage of the format. I propose to simplify this, basically treating rules with x labels as x rules, and remove the `WeakMultiLabels` class. 

Pros: reduce code complexity, get the `extend_matrix` functionality also for multi-label cases.
Cons: if at some point we find a label model that can take advantage of the 3-dim format, we must implement a method that transforms the 2-dim format.

title: docs(#1546): Add docker command to setup

labels.name: type: documentation
labels.description: Improvements or additions to documentation

body:
Closes #1546 

This PR adds the docker command to the setup guide.

rubrix.server.errors.base_errors.EntityNotFoundError: rubrix.api.errors::EntityNotFoundError(name=test,type=TokenClassification_DatasetSettings)

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Log data with:

`rb.log(name="test", records=rb.TokenClassificationRecord(text="hola dani", tokens=["hola", "dani"], prediction=[("name", 5,9, 0.8)]))`
2. Go to ['localhost:6900/datasets/rubrix/test'](http://localhost:6900/datasets/rubrix/test)
4.  Apparently no issues in the UI itself,  but you will see the error in the server logs

**Environment (please complete the following information):**

 - Rubrix Version [e.g. 0.10.0]: 0.15.0
 - ElasticSearch Version [e.g. 7.10.2]:
 - Docker Image (optional) [e.g. rubrix:v0.10.0]:  No docker image


**Additional context**
Add any other context about the problem here.

body: **Describe the bug** Looking for a dataset defined under a workspace other than default without passing a workspace will fail for admin users as 403 Operation not allowed error. **Expected behavior** An "Entity Not Found" error must be raised for those cases since the default workspace will be used if not provided in the request. **Screenshots** **Environment (please complete the following information):** - OS [e.g. iOS]: - Browser [e.g. chrome, safari]: - Rubrix Version [e.g. 0.10.0]: 0.14.0 - ElasticSearch Version [e.g. 7.10.2]: - Docker Image (optional) [e.g. rubrix:v0.10.0]: **Additional context** Add any other context about the problem here.

Helping some new users with the installation, we've encountered twice the same issue: is not very clear how to run elasticsearch with docker (you need to click on the link so you loose the page with the installation steps).

I suggest to directly add the command here too: https://rubrix.readthedocs.io/en/stable/getting_started/setup%26installation.html#launch-the-web-app after the we recommend (remove the link or add the link to more advanced settings of elastic)

title: [UI] Progress in the metrics sidebar is affected by refresh

labels.name: type: bug
labels.description: Indicates an unexpected problem or unintended behavior

labels.name: area: ui
labels.description: Indicates that an issue or pull request is related to the User Interface (UI)

body:
**Describe the bug**
When setting some filters and refreshing the page (F5), the Progress in the metrics sidebar does only take into account the records selected by the filters.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. For example, take the `score_filter_bug` dataset in our dev env
2. Set some filters to get a subset of records
3. Refresh your browser and open the Progress metric

**Expected behavior**
Progress metric should not be affected by refreshs.

**Environment (please complete the following information):**
 - OS [e.g. iOS]: Ubuntu
 - Browser [e.g. chrome, safari]: Firefox/Chrome
 - Rubrix Version [e.g. 0.10.0]: tested with dev env and latest release
 - ElasticSearch Version [e.g. 7.10.2]: dev env
 - Docker Image (optional) [e.g. rubrix:v0.10.0]: dev env

title: "Predicted as" filter activates highlighting of words

labels.name: type: bug
labels.description: Indicates an unexpected problem or unintended behavior

labels.name: area: ui
labels.description: Indicates that an issue or pull request is related to the User Interface (UI)

body:
**Describe the bug**
When activating the *Predicted as* filter, words that match the predicted as value, seem to be highlighted.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Go to the `score_filter_bug` dataset in our dev env
2. Select `palestine`, for example, in the "Predictions -> Predicted as" filter

**Expected behavior**
Only search terms should be highlighted in my understanding.

**Screenshots**
![Screenshot from 2022-06-02 17-45-27](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15979778/171670500-792f2090-30c9-40dc-9a5b-262a292db3a0.png)


**Environment (please complete the following information):**
 - OS [e.g. iOS]: ubuntu 20.04
 - Browser [e.g. chrome, safari]: firefox/chrome
 - Rubrix Version [e.g. 0.10.0]: dev env
 - ElasticSearch Version [e.g. 7.10.2]: dev env
 - Docker Image (optional) [e.g. rubrix:v0.10.0]: dev env


**Additional context**
Add any other context about the problem here.

title: Histogram not aligned in Prediction -> Score filter

labels.name: type: bug
labels.description: Indicates an unexpected problem or unintended behavior

labels.name: area: ui
labels.description: Indicates that an issue or pull request is related to the User Interface (UI)

body:
**Describe the bug**
In the Prediction -> Score filter, the histogram is not aligned with the score selector.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Go to our dev env and check out the `score_filter_bug` dataset
2. Try to use the Prediction -> Score filter

**Expected behavior**
The histogram should be aligned with the score selector.

**Screenshots**
![Screenshot from 2022-06-02 15-34-16](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15979778/171641924-7e7e3964-f433-4654-84bd-e7e30a6d195f.png)
In the screenshot, the filter is already applied. Scores in the most likely prediction go from 25 to roughly 47. 


**Environment (please complete the following information):**
 - OS [e.g. iOS]: Ubuntu 20.04
 - Browser [e.g. chrome, safari]: Firefox
 - Rubrix Version [e.g. 0.10.0]: 0.15.0dev
 - ElasticSearch Version [e.g. 7.10.2]: dev environment
 - Docker Image (optional) [e.g. rubrix:v0.10.0]:  -

body: **Describe the bug** The global actions checkbox is enabled as default when no data is found. **To Reproduce** Steps to reproduce the behavior: Open the annotation view, filter to return no records, and see the magic **Expected behavior** This check should be disabled in this case. **Screenshots** **Environment (please complete the following information):** - OS [e.g. iOS]: - Browser [e.g. chrome, safari]: - Rubrix Version [e.g. 0.10.0]: 0.14 - ElasticSearch Version [e.g. 7.10.2]: - Docker Image (optional) [e.g. rubrix:v0.10.0]: **Additional context** NA

title: Stopping `rb.log` keep background logging thread running

labels.name: type: bug
labels.description: Indicates an unexpected problem or unintended behavior

milestone.title: v0.15.0
milestone.description: This Milestone manages the feature and fixes that will be included in release 0.15.0

body:
**Describe the bug**
Stopping `rb.log` keep the background logging thread running. The whole process should be stopped

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Log a large dataset using the `rb.log` command
2. Stop the running logging with a `KeyboardInterruptError`
3. The `rb.log` statement stops, but it continues logging data.

**Expected behavior**
Once the `rb.log` is stopped, no more data should be logged.

**Screenshots**
N/A

**Environment (please complete the following information):**
 - OS [e.g. iOS]:
 - Browser [e.g. chrome, safari]:
 - Rubrix Version [e.g. 0.10.0]: 0.14
 - ElasticSearch Version [e.g. 7.10.2]:
 - Docker Image (optional) [e.g. rubrix:v0.10.0]:  


**Additional context**
N/A

title: The "Copy dataset" action creates the new one without write privileges

labels.name: type: bug
labels.description: Indicates an unexpected problem or unintended behavior

labels.name: area: server
labels.description: Indicates that an issue or pull request is related to the server

milestone.title: v0.15.0
milestone.description: This Milestone manages the feature and fixes that will be included in release 0.15.0

body:
**Describe the bug**
When copying a dataset (`rb.log` or API), the copied one cannot be modified (validate records, or annotate)

**To Reproduce**

1. `rb.copy` an existing dataset
2. Try to validate or create an annotation in the new dataset

**Expected behavior**
The copied dataset should accept modifications

**Screenshots**
N/A

**Environment (please complete the following information):**
 - OS [e.g. iOS]:

 - Rubrix Version [e.g. 0.10.0]: 0.14
 - ElasticSearch Version [e.g. 7.10.2]:
